arm_group.description: Docusate natrium and sorbitol, 240 ml enema, the evening before surgery
Bisacodyl, suppository 10 mg, the evening before surgery.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study investigated the effect of preoperative bowel preparations for patients
      undergoing spinal fusion surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study About Effect of Preoperative Bowel Preparation Versus no Bowel Preparation Before Spinal Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
This was a randomised clinical trial with one control group and two treatment groups.

      Forty-five elective spinal fusion patients were randomised into three groups who received
      preoperative treatment with either enema of sorbitol and docusat natrium, Bisacodyl
      suppository or no bowel preparation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients undergoing spinal fusion surgery

          -  Age 15 years or older

          -  The patients had to understand oral and written Norwegian.

          -  Postoperative pain management via epidural catheter should have been planned.

          -  Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Constipation

          -  Regularly use of enema

clinical_study.official_title: Preoperative Bowel Preparation Versus no Preparation Before Spinal Surgery: a Randomised Clinical Trial

other_outcome.measure: The study's outcome measures were recorded every evening between 17.00 and 21.00 hours

other_outcome.time_frame: The study's outcome measures were recorded every evening between 17.00 and 21.00 hours
